The '''Outer Path — Samsara of Heavenly Life Technique''' is a [[reincarnation ninjutsu]] used through the [[Outer Path]], which can infuse new life into the bodies of the dead in exchange for the user's own life.

== Usage ==
When this technique is activated, the [[King of Hell]] emerges from the ground and releases the souls of the deceased from its mouth. These souls may be recalled from even the crossroad between life and the [[Pure Land|afterlife]], and are then returned to their rejuvenated bodies. The exact limitations of this technique are unknown, but on one occasion, it was able to resurrect a large number of individuals who had recently died. While using this technique, the caster is severely weakened; for instance, [[Nagato]]'s hair turned white as a result of overexerting his power.<ref name="ch449">''Naruto'' chapter 449</ref><ref>''Naruto'' chapter 510, page 17</ref> Ultimately, once the technique is finished, the user invariably dies.<ref name="c614">''Naruto'' chapter 614, pages 5-6</ref>

This technique can also be used to transform the corpse vessel of an individual revived by [[Summoning: Impure World Reincarnation]] into a real body of living flesh and blood.<ref name="c656">''Naruto'' chapter 656, pages 14-17</ref> However, whereas the rest of the reincarnated [[Madara Uchiha]]'s body was made real, his [[Rinnegan|eyes]] instead crumbled into dust upon his resurrection. This method does not require the King of Hell to appear.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 657, page 1</ref>

The revived individuals are seemingly revived with a fully restored chakra level, as Kakashi did not require hospitalization to recover after revival, and was able to carry Naruto after he nearly passes out after his fight with Pain.

== Trivia ==
* When written as '輪廻転生', ''Rinne Tensei'' means "the circle of transmigration" or "metempsychosis".
* [[Hashirama Senju]] identified this technique as a {{translation|''Six Paths Kinjutsu''|六道の禁術|Rikudō no Kinjutsu|lit meaning=Six Paths Forbidden Technique}}.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 637, page 2</ref>
* When Nagato was preparing to use this technique, [[Konan]] feared for the worst due to his low chakra levels, implying she believed he could have potentially survived with more chakra.<ref name="ch449"/> However, according to the [[Jin no Sho|fourth databook]], usage of this technique always comes at the cost of the user's life.<ref name=d4/>
* Madara — and [[Obito]] under the guise of Madara — noted that this technique was supposed to be used to revive him.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 453, page 18</ref><ref>''Naruto'' chapter 601, page 11</ref> Madara would eventually be revived by Impure World Reincarnation instead, and expressed surprise and disappointment that his return didn't go as planned, as only a living person can become the [[Ten-Tails]]' [[jinchūriki]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 559, pages 1-2</ref><ref name="c614"/> Eventually, [[Black Zetsu]] successfully [[Body Coating|forced]] Obito to perform this technique on Madara.<ref name="c656"/> Obito was then able to temporarily survive the effects of using this technique due to Black Zetsu attaching to his body.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 657, page 10</ref> After this, Naruto temporarily stabilised Obito's life force using his [[Six Paths Yang Power]] like he did with [[Might Guy]] after he used the [[Eight Gates Released Formation]], allowing him to bring back Sasuke and later battle against [[Kaguya Ōtsutsuki]]. However, as the both noted, Obito would still die as a result from using this technique.
